alert.note: Alert for Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 7:09PM EST until December 24 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Baker River At Rumney affecting Grafton County. Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. For the Baker River...including Rumney...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Warner River...including Davisville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Warner River at Davisville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Although no structures are affected, water inundates recreational areas in Warner and Davisville. The river is at bankfull in other reaches, some erosion may occur. At 8.0 feet, Riverside Road floods along with increasing depths over recreational fields in Warner. At 10.0 feet, Low lying roads along the Warner River begin to have a flood threat. The most flood prone areas include West Joppa Road in Warner, cutting off access to the Dalton covered bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 8.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
